# Dynamic ICE menu code generated from Dummy_CreateICENode # If you want to write your own menu items for use in the ICE Tree window it would be much less complicated. # Most of the code below is handling the dynamic menu item creation and destruction # (depending on which key was pressed by the user when menu item was clicked)
def Script_Execute (oContext): #Dont rename this function siWarning = 4 ClickedMenuItemNumber = oContext.ClickedMenuItemNumber #Get the clicked menu item number oClickedMenu = oContext.ClickedMenu #Get the Menu object in which user has clicked oView = oContext.CurrentXSIView #Get the current Softimage view object if (oView != None) and (oView.Type == "ICE Tree"): #Are we working in an ICE Tree view? ActiveIceOpFullName = oView.GetAttributeValue("container") #Get the ICE Op if ActiveIceOpFullName != "": #Value type of returned ICE container is "string", make sure it's not empty before we continue...
# If Shift was pressed, add the recently created ICE node as a new Menu item # Lets see if the user pressed any modifier keys. When ALt was pressed while clicking the menu item, delete the clicked menu item.
keyState = Application.GetKeyboardState() #Get currently pressed modifier keys (Shift, Ctrl, Alt)
if keyState[1] == 1: #Is Shift pressed? -> Try adding the last created ICE/Render node to the clicked QMenu in case its Softimage 2012 or higher if oContext.SoftimageMainVersion >= 10: #Adding menu items from recently created ICE nodes only works in XSI 2012 and later globalQMenuItems = oContext.MenuItems if (len(oContext.LastICENodes)>0): #Do we have a recently created ICE node in the list? LastCreatedNodeString = oContext.LastICENodes[len(oContext.LastICENodes)-1] #Get Node creation command and Preset name from the recorded list of recently created ICE nodes print ("Last Created Node String was: " + LastCreatedNodeString) LastCreatedNodeData = LastCreatedNodeString.split(";") #Convert the string to a list separated by ";" SelectedNodeFullName = oView.GetAttributeValue("selection") #Get the last ICE node's name in the scene if SelectedNodeFullName != "": print ("SelectedNodes full name is: " + str(SelectedNodeFullName)) oSelectedNode = Application.Dictionary.GetObject(SelectedNodeFullName) #Get the actual Node object from the name by looking it up in the dictionary if oSelectedNode != None: #We have an actual object? SelectedNodeName = oSelectedNode.Name NewMenuItem = Application.QMenuGetByName("MenuItem", SelectedNodeName) if NewMenuItem == None: IceCommand = LastCreatedNodeData[0] #Get node creation command that was used create the last ICE node (commands differ depending on type of node created, like compounds or base nodes) Application.LogMessage("Last ICECOMMAND was :" + str(IceCommand)) Preset = LastCreatedNodeData[1] #Get ICE node's preset file path
#Get the dummy code DummyMenuItem = Application.QMenuGetByName("MenuItem","Dummy_CreateICENode") MenuItemCode = DummyMenuItem.Code
#Concatenate the keywords, they should not appear in one string here so they are not accidentally replaced by the menu's code MenuItemCode = DummyMenuItem.Code MenuItemCode = MenuItemCode.replace(("ICE" + "COMMAND"), IceCommand) MenuItemCode = MenuItemCode.replace(("PRE" + "SET"), Preset) print ("/n") print "##################" print (MenuItemCode) print "##################"
#Assemble new menu item from data we have aquired NewMenuItem = Application.QMenuCreateObject("MenuItem") NewMenuItem.Code = MenuItemCode NewMenuItem.Name = SelectedNodeName NewMenuItem.Category = "ICE"
Application.LogMessage("Shift key was pressed -> Adding a new menu item for most recently created ICE Node " + SelectedNodeName ) globalQMenuItems.addMenuItem(NewMenuItem) #Also store it in the global list of menu items in case user wants to safe the file else: Application.LogMessage("Shift key was pressed -> Adding an already existing menu item for most recently created ICE Node " + SelectedNodeName )
oClickedMenu.insertMenuItem( ClickedMenuItemNumber , NewMenuItem ) #Store the new menu item in the clicked menu
else: Application.LogMessage("No ICE node was selected to derive the new Menu Item's name from. Create A new node, leave it selected and try again please.",siWarning) else: Application.LogMessage("Sorry, creating menu items for ICE nodes only works in Softimage 2012", siWarning)
#Was/is the Alt key pressed? -> Remove the clicked Menu Item from the QMenu if (keyState[1] == 4): oClickedMenu.removeMenuItemAtIndex (ClickedMenuItemNumber)
#Neither Alt nor Shift keys are pressed, execute the menu item normally if (keyState[1] != 1 and keyState[1] != 4): Application.ICECOMMAND ("PRESET", ActiveIceOpFullName)

# Dynamic ICE menu code generated from Dummy_CreateFirstICENode # If you want to write your own menu items for use in the ICE Tree window it would be much less complicated. # Most of the code below is handling the dynamic menu item creation and destruction # (depending on which key was pressed by the user when menu item was clicked)
def Script_Execute (oContext): #Dont rename this function siWarning = 4 ClickedMenuItemNumber = oContext.ClickedMenuItemNumber #Get the clicked menu item number oClickedMenu = oContext.ClickedMenu #Get the Menu object in which user has clicked oView = oContext.CurrentXSIView #Get the current Softimage view object if (oView != None) and (oView.Type == "ICE Tree"): #Are we working in an ICE Tree view? ActiveIceOpFullName = oView.GetAttributeValue("container") #Get the ICE Op if ActiveIceOpFullName != "": #Value type of returned ICE container is "string", make sure it's not empty before we continue...
# If Shift was pressed, add the recently created ICE node as a new Menu item # Lets see if the user pressed any modifier keys. When ALt was pressed while clicking the menu item, delete the clicked menu item.
keyState = Application.GetKeyboardState() #Get currently pressed modifier keys (Shift, Ctrl, Alt)
if keyState[1] == 1: #Is Shift pressed? -> Try adding the last created ICE/Render node to the clicked QMenu in case its Softimage 2012 or higher if oContext.SoftimageMainVersion >= 10: #Adding menu items from recently created ICE nodes only works in XSI 2012 and later globalQMenuItems = oContext.MenuItems if (len(oContext.LastICENodes)>0): #Do we have a recently created ICE node in the list? LastCreatedNodeString = oContext.LastICENodes[len(oContext.LastICENodes)-1] #Get Node creation command and Preset name from the recorded list of recently created ICE nodes print ("Last Created Node String was: " + LastCreatedNodeString) LastCreatedNodeData = LastCreatedNodeString.split(";") #Convert the string to a list separated by ";" SelectedNodeFullName = oView.GetAttributeValue("selection") #Get the last ICE node's name in the scene if SelectedNodeFullName != "": print ("SelectedNodes full name is: " + str(SelectedNodeFullName)) oSelectedNode = Application.Dictionary.GetObject(SelectedNodeFullName) #Get the actual Node object from the name by looking it up in the dictionary if oSelectedNode != None: #We have an actual object? SelectedNodeName = oSelectedNode.Name NewMenuItem = Application.QMenuGetByName("MenuItem", SelectedNodeName) if NewMenuItem == None: IceCommand = LastCreatedNodeData[0] #Get node creation command that was used create the last ICE node (commands differ depending on type of node created, like compounds or base nodes) Application.LogMessage("Last ICECOMMAND was :" + str(IceCommand)) Preset = LastCreatedNodeData[1] #Get ICE node's preset file path
#Get the dummy code DummyMenuItem = Application.QMenuGetByName("MenuItem","Dummy_CreateICENode") MenuItemCode = DummyMenuItem.Code
#Concatenate the keywords, they should not appear in one string here so they are not accidentally replaced by the menu's code MenuItemCode = DummyMenuItem.Code MenuItemCode = MenuItemCode.replace(("ICE" + "COMMAND"), IceCommand) MenuItemCode = MenuItemCode.replace(("PRE" + "SET"), Preset) print ("/n") print "##################" print (MenuItemCode) print "##################"
#Assemble new menu item from data we have aquired NewMenuItem = Application.QMenuCreateObject("MenuItem") NewMenuItem.Code = MenuItemCode NewMenuItem.Name = SelectedNodeName NewMenuItem.Category = "ICE"
Application.LogMessage("Shift key was pressed -> Adding a new menu item for most recently created ICE Node " + SelectedNodeName ) globalQMenuItems.addMenuItem(NewMenuItem) #Also store it in the global list of menu items in case user wants to safe the file else: Application.LogMessage("Shift key was pressed -> Adding an already existing menu item for most recently created ICE Node " + SelectedNodeName )
oClickedMenu.insertMenuItem( ClickedMenuItemNumber , NewMenuItem ) #Store the new menu item in the clicked menu
else: Application.LogMessage("No ICE node was selected to derive the new Menu Item's name from. Create A new node, leave it selected and try again please.",siWarning) else: Application.LogMessage("Sorry, creating menu items for ICE nodes only works in Softimage 2012", siWarning)
#Was/is the Alt key pressed? -> Default ICE Menu item cannot be removed if (keyState[1] == 4): Application.LogMessage("Alt-key was pressed, but default ICE node menu item cannot be removed from this menu.", siWarning)

#The following code adds a menu item per light in the scene to the bottom of the menu # which selects the respective light (or inspects it when ctrl key is pressed at the same time)
def QMenu_Menu_Execute( oContext ): #Don't rename this function! self = oContext.ThisQMenuObject self.removeAllTempMenuItems() #Clear the temp menu items so they don't pile up in the mneu after subsequent calls Lights = Application.ActiveSceneRoot.FindChildren("", "light", "", True) oDummyMenuItem = Application.QMenuGetByName("MenuItem","Dummy_LightSelector") DummyCode = oDummyMenuItem.Code
for oLight in Lights: oLightMenuItem = Application.QMenuCreateObject("MenuItem") LightSpecificCode = DummyCode.replace("LIGHTNAME", oLight.FullName) oLightMenuItem.Name = oLight.FullName oLightMenuItem.code = LightSpecificCode #Set the code in the Menu Item we have concatenated above self.appendTempMenuItem (oLightMenuItem) #Add the menu item to the list of temporary menu items of this menu
def QMenu_Menu_Execute( oContext ): #Don't rename this function! #Add your script code here pass

#The following code adds a menu item per camera in the scene to the bottom of the menu # which selects the respective light (or inspects it when ctrl key is pressed at the same time)
def QMenu_Menu_Execute( oContext ): #Don't rename this function! self = oContext.ThisQMenuObject self.removeAllTempMenuItems() #Clear the temp menu items so they don't pile up in the menu after subsequent calls Cameras = Application.ActiveSceneRoot.FindChildren("", "camera", "", True) oDummyMenuItem = Application.QMenuGetByName("MenuItem","Dummy_CameraSelector") DummyCode = oDummyMenuItem.Code
for oCam in Cameras: oCamMenuItem = Application.QMenuCreateObject("MenuItem") CameraSpecificCode = DummyCode.replace("CAMNAME", oCam.FullName) oCamMenuItem.Name = oCam.FullName oCamMenuItem.Code = CameraSpecificCode #Set the code in the Menu Item we have concatenated above self.appendTempMenuItem (oCamMenuItem) #Add the menu item to the list of temporary menu items of this menu
def QMenu_Menu_Execute ( oContext ): #Don't rename this function! #Add your script code here pass

def QMenu_Menu_Execute( oContext ): #Don't rename this function! self = oContext.ThisQMenuObject self.removeAllTempMenuItems() #Clear the temp menu items so they don't pile up in the menu after subsequent calls Cams = Application.ActiveSceneRoot.FindChildren("", "Light", "", True)
for oCam in Cams: if Application.GetValue(oCam.FullName + ".light.Type") == 2: oCamItem = Application.QMenuCreateObject("MenuItem") oCamItem.Name = oCam.FullName
Code = ('def Script_Execute (oContext):
	oVM = Application.Desktop.ActiveLayout.Views.Find( "View Manager" )
') Code+= ('	oView = oVM.GetAttributeValue("focusedviewport")
') Code += ('	oVM.SetAttributeValue("activecamera:" + oView + "","' + oCam.FullName + '")
')
oCamItem.code = Code self.appendTempMenuItem (oCamItem)

def QMenu_Menu_Execute( oContext ): #Don't rename this function! self = oContext.ThisQMenuObject self.removeAllTempMenuItems() #Clear the temp menu items so they don't pile up in the menu after subsequent calls Cams = Application.ActiveSceneRoot.FindChildren("", "Camera", "", True)
for oCam in Cams: oCamItem = Application.QMenuCreateObject("MenuItem") oCamItem.Name = oCam.FullName
Code = ('def Script_Execute ( oContext ):
	') Code += ('oVM = Application.Desktop.ActiveLayout.Views.Find( "View Manager" )
	') Code += ('oView = oVM.GetAttributeValue("focusedviewport")
	') Code += ('oVM.SetAttributeValue("activecamera:" + oView + "","' + oCam.FullName + '")
')
oCamItem.code = Code self.appendTempMenuItem (oCamItem)
